articles.author: Anastasiia Malenko, Tom Balmforth, Max Hunder
articles.description: Ukraine fired a volley of British Storm Shadow cruise missiles into Russia on Wednesday, the latest new Western weapon it has been permitted to use on Russian targets a day after it fired U.S. ATACMS missiles.
articles.title: Ukraine launches UK cruise missiles into Russia, a day after using US ATACMS

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Hamas' acting Gaza chief Khalil al-Hayya said in remarks broadcast on Wednesday that there would be no hostages-for-prisoners swap deal with Israel unless the war in the Palestinian enclave ended.
articles.title: Hamas: No hostages-for-prisoners swap deal with Israel unless Gaza war ends

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Israeli forces killed at least 48 Palestinians in the Gaza Strip on Wednesday, including a rescue worker, health officials said, as troops deepened an incursion along the territory's northern edge, bombarding a hospital and blowing up homes.
articles.title: Israeli strikes kill 48 people in Gaza, hospital in north makes distress call

articles.author: David Brunnstrom, Simon Lewis
articles.description: The United States will veto a U.N. Security Council resolution for a ceasefire in Israel's war in Gaza if it is brought to a vote in its current form, a senior U.S. official said on Wednesday, accusing council members of cynically rejecting attempts at reaching a compromise.
articles.title: US will veto UN Security Council resolution on Gaza war in its current form, says official

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China's defense minister declined a meeting with U.S. Defense Secretary Lloyd Austin during a meeting of defense leaders in Laos, a move the Pentagon chief said on Wednesday was unfortunate.
articles.title: Chinese defense minister declines meeting with Pentagon chief

articles.author: Simon Lewis, Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: The Biden administration has moved to forgive about $4.7 billion in U.S. loans to Ukraine, State Department spokesperson Matthew Miller said on Wednesday, as outgoing officials seek to do what they can before leaving office to bolster Ukraine in its war against Russia.
articles.title: Biden administrations moves to forgive $4.7 billion of loans to Ukraine

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A top Kenyan security advisor said on Wednesday that her nation backs calls from Haiti for the United Nations to consider turning a current international security mission in the Caribbean nation into a formal U.N. peacekeeping mission.
articles.title: Kenya backs Haiti's call for peacekeeping mission, advisor says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Nicaraguan President Daniel Ortega proposed a constitutional reform to expand presidential powers over other branches of government, according to an official document seen by Reuters on Wednesday.
articles.title: Nicaragua proposes reform to expand presidential powers

articles.author: Fadimata Kontao
articles.description: Mali's Prime Minister Choguel Maiga has been fired, state television ORTM said on Wednesday of the civilian who criticised the ruling junta's failure to organise elections within a promised 24-month transition back to democracy.
articles.title: Mali's PM fired after criticizing prolonged junta rule, state TV says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Southern Africa's regional bloc on Wednesday extended by a year its troop deployment in Democratic Republic of Congo, where it is helping the government fight rebel groups.
articles.title: Southern African bloc extends troop deployment in Congo by a year
